text: I had these scope issues as well despite seeming to have granted the correct permissions. I eventually settled for using an API key instead of OAuth if you just need to pull contacts.

hello everyone, if we want to use our custom website forms with HubSpot, is this the correct and most recent API? (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3_authentication>) Thanks in advance!

Hello Team
How to add workflow trigger, when i add note for ticket from hotspot panel ?
Is there anyone familiar with paging/paged API calls? The CRM API only allows 100 entries per request. I am wondering how you can utilise paging, the documentation is rather lacking on this topic!

if you get the below snippet in the response of a call, it means there are more pages to fetch. you then extract the "after" value ("NTI1Cg%3D%3D" in this case), and send that as a query string parameter named "after" in the next call.

  `"paging": {`
    `"next": {`
      `"after": "NTI1Cg%3D%3D",`
      `"link": "?after=NTI1Cg%3D%3D"`
    `}`
  `}`
"paging" is a top level node in the response, by the way - sibling of "results"

Hello Team
I need set trigger when add ticket note from only panel.
I will set trigger but now trigger called when add note from API with associate to ticket engagement. but i need trigger called when add note from only HubSpot panel and not need to trigger called when add from API.
So please give me steps for solution.
Class, this helped me a lot, thank you! Hoping others who will run into the same issue will notice this
it’s been a few days, and it just occurred to me that `results` is probably an array, which means that you could not use `append` as I had suggested. It would have to be `extend` in that case

Put a tag in the note body and then route from there. API created notes can have something like [API] at the bottom so you can maybe put that on the trigger or make a branch after or even use custom code

Hello! I wanted to ask you a question. I have a client who has developed his own application to send SMS. This app is only used by them and they want us to connect it with their HubSpot instance to launch SMS within a workflow. They don't have Operations Hub Pro so they can't use custom code. The option I had thought of was to create a private application, the problem is that from the workflow section I can only access public applications. Is it possible to create a public application that can only be used by this client so that it is visible from Workflow? In case you can't or shouldn't, do you know any alternative to connect this SMS sending application without hiring Operations HubPro? Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.
You can use the private app
